column1: Pretty good I learned a lot
I put three stars because it should be specified more how basic this course is
is almost that this is done for somebody that does not know almost anything from CS
Too much material Too soon I am new to R and the stuff was a bit overwhelming
The course got easier as I advanced through the other courses
This course is more of an overview of what is to come
A lot of what is presented here could just be in the format of a word or PDF with a series of links
for people that might have some experience with R statistics and ML in general this is way to basic
I suppose it is ok as a foundation it does not offer much on its own
Somewhat interesting to get an idea of what can be done with Github but I do not feel prepared to actually use it
I am aware that this is the introduction to this topic but it was a bit long drawn out
all the content of the course could be a week of some course of specialization
overall it was ok though not yet extremely intense or informative
Few content for an entire course I think this one could be together with R Programming
But the peer graded setting of projects really delays the grant of certificate
It took me more than two sessions of waiting just to get a grade for the peer review project
this course is not well organized at all Instructors basically just read words in slides
no interesting examples and no hands on practices
especially week 4 slides that look like a syntax reference document
all  Instructors basically just read words in slides
no interesting examples and no hands-on practices
especially week 4 slides that look like a syntax reference document
So the entire instruction is very boring
making me wonder why I need to sit here and listen to word reading rather than buying a textbook
This entire specialization is the one that I have taken and feel the worst

Not that useful
Too simple and most contents are overlapped already covered in other sessions
Very average do not feel I learnt much Still not sure if it is over or not since I have submitted a peer review assignment and cannot go any further
A good attempt to give introduction on basic Data Science tools though most videos end abruptly which spoils the seamless navigation experience Maybe the team can work on this
The course was just fine but I do not think we should spent entire 4 weeks on it One or two week for this course would be better I think

Not a bad first course but not what I expected
Too few activities for the time allocated
A little bit too slow and too easy
I had a very bad experience with this whole course set-up
Especially the peer grading you have no insight on why they assigned this score to you nothing
especially when you know you did your course work correctly i will never come back to coursera waste of money
This course stays on the surface and does not delve too deep
probably in order to not scare off people who are new to the subject
I can slog thru the programming but I doubt it is the best way to do something
but I never get to see how something should have been done
Not bad but certainly not good
Not very helpful Unnecessarily lengthy
If you do not know any thing about data sciencegood introduction
a wast of time

Worthless course There should have been no need for this course and the fact that they charge money for this is disappointing

A little boring Necessary if you have ABSOLUTELY no experience with data analysis
Not really useful
If you are not already experienced in data science it also requires a fair amount of imagination to picture what all these tools are actually used for
Very bad course so far Very little detail and Assignments are very hard to solve Worst $500 dollars spent in my life and the course is not worth even $10

too little materials can finish in two nights
annoying

Too basic not very informative Waste of money

very bad
this course is very poorly structured

but it is sufficient as a single week of content for a larger course

Very shallow overview not really a full course I would say
Did not learn anything in this one

so this was completely unnecessary

This class is more of just a vague overview of the other courses

less hands-on exercises and this course covers too much topics without details

he recording quality of some of the lectures is awful

this entire specialisation is of awful quality

it is a here's a few useful things in R course
and the instructors should be ashamed that their institution makes money from it
Seems like the course lectures are out of order or duplicated
I felt this course could have been added as sections to other courses One separate course for this topic is a waste of money
I had an unpleasant experience with assignments (so it is not a problem to receive knowledge  but problem to receive a certificate
The first problem is time Assignments are extreme time consuming They basically consist of scientific articles peer reviews
I did not need to read lecture material more than 1 time but I spent about 10 hours to complete 1 assignment (and you need to do 6 of them
Next problem with assignments So now I also need to worry about receiving bad grades from students  who will find 2 similar works
It is a very hard and time-consuming work and I was terrified to find my work copy pasted by other student
I found my work (my assignment) to be stolen for 2 times This is a nightmare for a person  who worked so hard
This is not like me judging too strictly - students just can not fulfil all the requirements Like they write only 2 points instead of 10 Maybe this is the cause why they still my work
And this article review is a very hard task if you don`t have any experience  so I found other students like 70% failing this task
This is not like me judging too strictly - students just can not fulfil all the requirements Like they write only 2 points instead of 10 Maybe this is the cause why they still my work
The course is not very popular so I am already waiting about month to be able to review 5 assignments from other students
About peer reviewing – this is not my first course on Coursera and I know that 5 peer reviews to complete the assignment is a lot usually 3 is enough
the last assignment is simply horror
If you don`t pass it - you can retake it only after a month when you have forgotten the half of material
And bonus - you will not see your mistakes as you usually do on Coursera so no cheating and coping your answers is possible
Course was extremely helpful and informative Condition of reviewing five assignments instead of three created a lot of problems due to non-availability of required submissions
I thought it was a shame that my elective assignment in week 6 was not marked - perhaps if you're offering extra assignments
I believe it will be useful for anyone looking to get a good understanding and grounding in quantitative methods	2
I found the course easy to follow through  and learned a lot about the historical background to philosophy and science as well as research methods
Absolutely well presented relevant and concise The interviews were really interesting and really expand and clarrfy some issues related to the vdeo lectures
Good course for people who are new to this branch of study
a robustly designed course with challenging assignments Your progress through this course will be rewarding
Excellent course beginner level but enlightening on so many levels Thank you for everything
It was an exceptional experience with University of Amsterdamsince this course is very well organized and the quality of teaching as well
I will attend the other 4 courses
I recommend it because in did increase my knowledge in social science methods
It was a well and clearly structured course Although rich in content it was enjoyable and useful to complete
This is a very helpful course for beginners

Love the lectures and how they are being carried out Easily digestible and understandable by prospective students
Amazing course and so detailed  first module is little bit boring but later on its so interactive and useful
Great course I learnt alot here Thanks to the instructor
This course was on a topic I have never been exposed to and will be necessary for ongoing research work

The quizzes  assignments and tests were at the right level and built to a crescendo Really can't say enough good things but will say that it was everything I needed and delivered with the highest professionalism than I had expected
The difficulty of the material for me was in the language and the newness of the content that was made quite easy to follow
very informative   liked the drawings idea it makes abstract concepts easier to digest
This course is exactly what I hoped it to be
Synthetic but always clear  challenging and high-level
I feel that I gained a good introductive knowledge of quantitative methods and I can't wait to follow the next courses
This course is quite interesting I have learned a lot and has exposed me to many things I do not know about research
This course was a nice introduction to quantitative methods

Among all the MOOCs around the internet this course is one of my favorite
Great course for anyone interested in thinking like a professional scientist

This course was excellent in all aspects including the interesting and extensive material as well as Dr Annemarie Zand Scholten's brilliant lectures that help students digest and enjoy the content
the first 3 weeks were a little difficult to follow but then i catch up with the terms and definitions week 4 became very enjoyable wish i could took the quiz without payment

Quite a nice refresher  Must do for all the researchers
This course was just amazing
Thank you so much for the structured fundamental information and the additional interviews which were very valuable

I love the way it is structured and especially the way the matherial learned was reflected in the tasks for each week It is nothing like the formal education I have got in my country and I am really grateful for an opportunity to learn form greatest minds while sitting at home
Concise and thorough course on the current methodology of quantitative research  grounded on a historical development
Good video's  relevant quizes and peer review essays
A really great course
I also really like it how this University does not assume you know everything  and starts from the start
I loved the pictures used as examples and the bonus interviews really helped me gain a deeper understanding of the material
It was excellent Useful and understandable
Very good groundwork
I certainly recommend it to anyone interested in research methods  statistics or better preparing for graduate-level work and research in general
I strongly believe the dedicated work by Dr Annemarie Zand Scholten the course creator and professor along with the whole team did a superb job
I was extremely impressed and pleased both by the professor

I would highly recommend this course to those new to the subject
I liked the course very much
This is course was put together very well

Excellent

Great course
Extra ordinary course deliverycontentand research training
This is one of the best courses I have taken on Coursera or even in traditional university
This was a great introduction to Quantitative research methods
By the end of it  I really felt that I had gained a lot of valuable knowledge
The explanations are simple and easy to follow  and cover the topics in quite a lot of depth
The assignments are demanding and challenging  but doable  and it is nice that analytic and creative essays are combined so as to not put too much strain on students
creative assignments are more fun and light weight  while the analytical assignments provide an opportunity to revise the materials more carefully and delve into the core of the topics
Great course  taught by very passionate lecturers who know their stuff
A very clearly structured and presented course
useful and comprehensive Highly recommended
